availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Aaron Donald Kennedy (Logan County, merchant, postmaster, and county judge)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, merchant, grocer, postmaster, and county judge. Tennessee native. Married to Mary B. Gordon Kennedy on November 7, 1835. Father of Benjamin Kennedy, John W. Kennedy, and Mary Virginia Kennedy. Merchant in Logan County in 1850. Postmaster in Gordonsville from January 31, 1855 to December 28, 1864. Grocer in Logan County in 1860. Presiding judge of the Logan County Court in Logan County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 108A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 23.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Gordonsville, p. 379A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film #000367186, p. 75.
Find A Grave, "Aaron Donald Kennedy (1815-1890)," Memorial #48252481, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48252481 (accessed December 3, 2018).
KYR-0002-022-0102.
